name: NSLayoutConstraint.Attribute
desc: The part of the object’s visual representation that should be used to get the value for the constraint.

items.name: case left
items.desc: The left side of the object’s alignment rectangle.

items.name: case right
items.desc: The right side of the object’s alignment rectangle.

items.name: case top
items.desc: The top of the object’s alignment rectangle.

items.name: case bottom
items.desc: The bottom of the object’s alignment rectangle.

items.name: case leading
items.desc: The leading edge of the object’s alignment rectangle.

items.name: case trailing
items.desc: The trailing edge of the object’s alignment rectangle.

items.name: case width
items.desc: The width of the object’s alignment rectangle.

items.name: case height
items.desc: The height of the object’s alignment rectangle.

items.name: case centerX
items.desc: The center along the x-axis of the object’s alignment rectangle.

items.name: case centerY
items.desc: The center along the y-axis of the object’s alignment rectangle.

items.name: case lastBaseline
items.desc: The object’s baseline. For objects with more than one line of text, this is the baseline for the bottommost line of text.

items.name: case firstBaseline
items.desc: The object’s baseline. For objects with more than one line of text, this is the baseline for the topmost line of text.

items.name: case leftMargin
items.desc: The object’s left margin. For UIView objects, the margins are defined by their layoutMargins property.

items.name: case rightMargin
items.desc: The object’s right margin. For UIView objects, the margins are defined by their layoutMargins property.

items.name: case topMargin
items.desc: The object’s top margin. For UIView objects, the margins are defined by their layoutMargins property.

items.name: case bottomMargin
items.desc: The object’s bottom margin. For UIView objects, the margins are defined by their layoutMargins property.

items.name: case leadingMargin
items.desc: The object’s leading margin. For UIView objects, the margins are defined by their layoutMargins property.

items.name: case trailingMargin
items.desc: The object’s trailing margin. For UIView objects, the margins are defined by their layoutMargins property.

items.name: case centerXWithinMargins
items.desc: The center along the x-axis between the object’s left and right margin. For UIView objects, the margins are defined by their layoutMargins property.

items.name: case centerYWithinMargins
items.desc: The center along the y-axis between the object’s top and bottom margin. For UIView objects, the margins are defined by their layoutMargins property.

items.name: case notAnAttribute
items.desc: A placeholder value that is used to indicate that the constraint’s second item and second attribute are not used in any calculations. Use this value when creating a constraint that assigns a constant to an attribute. For example, item1.height >= 40. If a constraint only has one item, set the second item to nil, and set the second attribute to NSLayoutAttributeNotAnAttribute.
